intro: Byrsanthes halliana, commonly known as the Hall's byrsanthes, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
